info.name: Bridge API Collection
info.description: APIs to move into, out of, and between any form of a dollar

item.name: customers

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: This is a customer id. If this is specified, the next page that starts with a customer right AFTER the specified customer id on the customer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that customers older than the specified customer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if ending_before is set)

This is a customer id. If this is specified, the previous page that ends with a customer right BEFORE the specified customer id on the customer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that customers newer than the specified customer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if starting_after is set)
The numbers of items to return (100 max)

request.description: Get the full list of all customers created on Bridge

response.name: List of customers (the returned list is empty if none found)

item.name: Request a hosted URL for customer ID verification.

query.description: (Optional) URL to redirect the user back to once ID verification flow is completed

request.description: The URL endpoint returned will take the user through a hosted ID verification flow. You can pass in a redirect URI that will be used to redirect back to your application once the ID verification flow is completed.

response.name: A Hosted URL for users to perform an ID verification

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: (Required) URL to redirect the user back to once ID verification flow is completed

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: (Required) URL to redirect the user back to once ID verification flow is completed

response.name: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: (Required) URL to redirect the user back to once ID verification flow is completed
The numbers of items to return (100 max)

This is a transfer id. If this is specified, the next page that starts with a transfer right AFTER the specified transfer id on the transfer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that transfers older than the specified transfer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if ending_before is set)

This is a transfer id. If this is specified, the previous page that ends with a transfer right BEFORE the specified transfer id on the transfer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that transfers newer than the specified transfer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if starting_after is set)
The hash of the transaction
This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated AFTER the specified timestamp will be returned
This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated BEFORE the specified timestamp will be returned

request.description: Get all active and completed transfers for a customer.

response.name: List of transfers (the returned list is empty if none found)

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: The numbers of items to return (100 max)

This is a transfer id. If this is specified, the next page that starts with a transfer right AFTER the specified transfer id on the transfer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that transfers older than the specified transfer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if ending_before is set)

This is a transfer id. If this is specified, the previous page that ends with a transfer right BEFORE the specified transfer id on the transfer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that transfers newer than the specified transfer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if starting_after is set)
The hash of the transaction

This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated BEFORE the specified timestamp will be returned

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: The numbers of items to return (100 max)

This is a transfer id. If this is specified, the next page that starts with a transfer right AFTER the specified transfer id on the transfer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that transfers older than the specified transfer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if ending_before is set)

This is a transfer id. If this is specified, the previous page that ends with a transfer right BEFORE the specified transfer id on the transfer timeline, which is always ordered from the newest to the oldest by creation time, will be returned. This also implies that transfers newer than the specified transfer id will be returned (shouldn't be set if starting_after is set)
The hash of the transaction
This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated AFTER the specified timestamp will be returned
This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated BEFORE the specified timestamp will be returned

This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated AFTER the specified timestamp will be returned
This is a unix timestamp in milliseconds. If this is specified, transfers updated BEFORE the specified timestamp will be returned
